intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Princess Tana! Grado’s forces are approaching!

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: What? So soon? Ah, we’ve had no time!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Milady, we lack the arms to defend this place. You must return to Castle Frelia.

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: I can’t! Not yet. We haven’t found Eirika and her companions yet. Eirika is my friend, and she needs my help. I won’t abandon her. Oh, I know! Go and ask Father– I mean King Hayden for more troops.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, Your Highness!

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Eirika, please be safe.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Commander Breguet, the enemy appears to be fortifying its position in the castle.

intro.speaker: Breguet
intro.line: Hmph. They’re tenacious, but they have no hope of stopping our advance.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: What are your orders, sir?

intro.speaker: Breguet
intro.line: Ha! Orders? You just stand here and watch. I’ll crush them myself!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: As you command, sir.

intro.speaker: Breguet
intro.line: Ha! That’s what happens when you face my lance!

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: St-stop right there! Call off your forces and turn back, or you’ll have me to deal with!

intro.speaker: Breguet
intro.line: Is that so? And who might you be?

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Who–? I am Tana, Princess of Frelia. I will not permit you to abuse my country any longer.

intro.speaker: Breguet
intro.line: Frelia’s royal brat, huh? How convenient...

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: Leave this castle immediately. If you harm me, my father and brother will chase you to the earth’s end.

intro.speaker: Breguet
intro.line: Yes, I’ve heard of how King Hayden dotes on his precious little daughter. Let’s see how true that is. You’ll make us a fine hostage, my dear. Seize the girl and lock her up!

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Right away, sir!

intro.speaker: Tana
intro.line: No! Let me go!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Seth, look...

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: I see it. It seems like Grado’s army has already reached Frelia. Princess, this place is perilous. We should bypass Mulan altogether and head straight to the castle.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: But we can’t just ignore this... You were there when Renais was invaded... You saw what I saw. You saw how the people suffered at the hands of Grado’s soldiers. Homes were destroyed, possessions stolen, women kidnapped... Anyone who resisted was executed without question, without hesitation.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Please, Seth. I can’t allow that to happen here. I don’t want to see any more people harmed by Grado’s atrocities.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: All right, Princess. I understand. Perhaps we can retake Mulan. But, Princess, you must act with caution. Your people need you, too.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Of course, Seth. Come on! Let’s go!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: I’ve found them! Stragglers from Renais! Don’t let them get away!

battle-talk.speaker: Franz
battle-talk.line: Princess Eirika, it is good to see you’re well.

battle-talk.speaker: Eirika
battle-talk.line: Franz, you made it through unscathed...

battle-talk.speaker: Franz
battle-talk.line: Y-yes, Your Highness! I met up with Sir Gilliam of Frelia and explained the situation in Renais. He told me that Princess Tana was in danger as well, here at Mulan. We rode as swiftly as we could.

battle-talk.speaker: Eirika
battle-talk.line: Tana is here? Franz, we must hurry!

battle-talk.speaker: Seth
battle-talk.line: Is that you, Franz? I’m relieved to see you’re still in one piece!

battle-talk.speaker: Franz
battle-talk.line: Y-yes... and you as well, General. As long as you lead us, sir, the Knights of Renais cannot lose!

battle-talk.speaker: Seth
battle-talk.line: Franz, you and I must work together to protect Princess Eirika. I want you to ride with us.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: The rumors are true, aren’t they? The Grado army’s taken over the castle. It looks like they’ve seized the castle gate, too. Smart work–the gate provides defense and heals wounds to boot. They must be fierce warriors to have taken the gate. Watch yourself.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: That knight encamped at the castle was wearing the finest armor I’ve seen. It looked like it could turn aside almost any blade you swing at it. I know my armor, though. I wager a good rapier or armorslayer could get through it.

boss.speaker: Breguet
boss.line: Bah, what a worthless lot of curs I’ve been assigned!

end.speaker: Tana
end.line: Sir Gilliam... I’m sorry, I never meant to cause you such trouble.

end.speaker: Gilliam
end.line: It was no trouble. I live to serve, Princess.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Tana, what are you doing, so far form Castle Frelia?

end.speaker: Tana
end.line: I heard that Renais had fallen, and I was so worried... But I’m glad to see that you’re safe... Wait! Where is Ephraim? Is he well?

end.speaker: Tana
end.line: You haven’t heard from him? Oh, I hope he’s not been harmed... Come, we must go to Castle Frelia. My lord father may know something.

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: Oh, Tana... I’m grateful to see that you’re safe and home again! You’ve no idea how I worried when I heard you were under attack at Border Mulan. You are not to leave again without my permission. Do you understand?

dialogue.speaker: Tana
dialogue.line: Don’t be mad, Father. Look, I come bearing good news. Eirika! Come out now!

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: King Hayden, I am please to see you again, even in these sad times.

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: Ah, Eirika! It does my heart good to see you safe.

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: Thank you. I was able to escape the castle before Renais fell. But I’m not sure if my father...

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: Yes. I... have received word of your father.

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: Your Highness? Please tell me. If my father well?

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: ...My friend King Fado...did not survive the fall of Renais Castle.

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: ...No, it cannot be...

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: Rest assured, Grado will be punished for its cowardly act. This is Frelia’s promise. Eirika, please stay here and rest. I cannot imagine how exhausted you must be.

dialogue.speaker: Seth
dialogue.line: King Hayden. You know of Prince Ephraim’s disappearance, do you not?

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: Yes, we hear the prince and his men hound Grado at every turn. It’s said that he’s led his forces into the empire itself. Reports suggest he’s crossed the border and now fights in Renvall.

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: My brother... He fights on? Even now?

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: Yes. My pegasus knights bought this information at a great price. Even though Renais has fallen, he charges into the enemy’s heart. He is truly Fado’s son... What a valiant youth. I wish I knew whether he remains unharmed, but I do not.

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: King Hayden, I thank you for your offer, but I cannot stay. I intend to ride to my brother’s side with reinforcements.

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: I cannot allow it. I know how you feel, but this plan is suicide. I would be betraying Fado’s memory if I allowed any harm to befall you. Stay here. Rest and mourn. Leave this war to the warriors.

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: I know you mean well, Your Majesty. However, I have lost my father, and my twin brother is in peril. My brother, he is a part of me... I cannot rest here in peace while he risks his life.

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: No. Renais has no more army. Grado’s forces decimated it. I wish Frelia could provide you with support, with soldiers, but... My son, Innes, is on his way to meet the empire’s forces. We cannot spare a single brigade. Your own retinue of knights cannot possibly face Grado alone. Are you so determined to go?

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: Yes. ...With apologies.

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: ...As resolute as your father, eh? What am I to do in the face of such foolhardy determination? Vanessa.

dialogue.speaker: Vanessa
dialogue.line: Here, Your Highness!

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: Moulder.

dialogue.speaker: Moulder
dialogue.line: You called, my king?

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: Gilliam.

dialogue.speaker: Gilliam
dialogue.line: Yes, sire?

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: You are to accompany Princess Eirika of Renais into Grado territory. I expect each of you to provide aid and support for her brother.

dialogue.speaker: Gilliam
dialogue.line: Hmm. Quite a grave responsibility you’ve given us.

dialogue.speaker: Vanessa
dialogue.line: No matter the obstacles, we will perform our duty.

dialogue.speaker: Gilliam
dialogue.line: Our lives are yours.

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: These are some of my most trusted and stalwart vassals. They will, no doubt, prove themselves quite valuable on your journey. Remember, you are venturing behind enemy lines. You will need supplies. I will have a supply convoy readied to carry your weapons and provisions. It will remain at your side, no matter how far afield you venture.

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: King Hayden, I... Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: Hayden
dialogue.line: No, save your thanks for your return... with your brother, Prince Ephraim.

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: Yes, Your highness!

dialogue.speaker: Tana
dialogue.line: Eirika, you don’t really intend to go through with this, do you? I can’t guess how you must feel, but its’ just too dangerous. What would happen if you were captured by Grado’s men?

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: Thank you for your concern, Tana. But I have no choice. Don’t you see, Tana? I have to go.

dialogue.speaker: Tana
dialogue.line: Eirika... Oh, why is this happening? What’s gone wrong with the world?

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: Tana...

dialogue.speaker: Tana
dialogue.line: Why would Grado invade? Emperor Vigarde is a man of peace. His people adore him. And you and Ephraim are friends with Prince Lyon, are you not? What could be behind this madness? Why is this happening...

dialogue.speaker: Eirika
dialogue.line: I have no answers for you, Tana. I don’t want to believe it, but the reality is that we are at war. If I do nothing, I may lose my brother as well as my father. This is why I have to fight. It’s the only answer I have.
